title: Duntroon: the Royal Military College of Australia [Long version]
brief_description: An account of the training of cadet officers at Australia’s military college. In the academic field, there are three courses open - general science, engineering, and arts. Life at the College is shown, including facilities for recreation; rooms for chess and music enthusiasts; clubs, a dance band and an amateur radio station. Duntroon has become famous for its parade ground efficiency and its traditions of loyalty, efficiency and responsibility. Narrated by Keith Eden, photography by Arthur Brown.
